title: The Wall Street Journal: Andrew McCabe gave memos on Trump conversations to Mueller
text:
Published: Mar 17, 2018 3:58 p.m. ET Share Getty Images Andrew McCabe, then serving as acting FBI director, testifies before a House appropriations subcommittee in June 2017. 
By Rebecca Ballhaus Del Quentin Wilber 
Former FBI Deputy Director Andrew McCabe wrote memos describing his conversations with President Donald Trump and other events and has turned them over to Special Counsel Robert Mueller, a person close to McCabe said Saturday. 
The memos, written very soon after the events they describe, cover McCabe’s dealings with the White House and what former FBI Director James Comey told McCabe about his interactions, according to the person. 
Read: Ex-FBI deputy director McCabe says he was ‘singled out’ for what he witnessed around Comey firing 
That revelation came amid an escalating war of words Saturday between Trump and some of the country’s most senior former law-enforcement and national security officials, sparked by McCabe’s dismissal late Friday. 
Attorney General Jeff Sessions terminated McCabe two days before his scheduled retirement, saying internal investigators found McCabe made an unauthorized disclosure to the media and “lacked candor” on multiple occasions. 
Read an expanded version of this article at WSJ.com Most popular on WSJ.com
